problem_summary_simple: Find the earliest day when two turned-on bulbs have exactly k off bulbs between them.
problem_summary_technical: Maps bulb positions to the day they turn on, then uses a sliding window to find the minimum day satisfying the k-empty-slot condition.
key_insights: Transforming the problem to days when bulbs turn on simplifies the search.
A sliding window approach efficiently checks adjacent turned-on bulbs.
The window size is `k+2` (two bulbs and `k` in between). The pointers `left` and `right` represent the indices of the two bulbs.
